functions.name: turf/aggregate
functions.description: Calculates a series of aggregations for a set of  Point|points within a set of {@link Polygon|polygons}. Sum, average, count, min, max, and deviation are supported.

parameters.name: polygons
parameters.description: polygons with values on which to aggregate

returns.description: polygons with properties listed based on outField values in aggregations

functions.name: turf/along
functions.description: Takes a  LineString|line and returns a {@link Point|point} at a specified distance along the line.

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

functions.name: turf/area
functions.description:
Takes a one or more features and returns their area
in square meters.

functions.name: turf/average
functions.description: Calculates the average value of a field for a set of  Point|points within a set of {@link Polygon|polygons}.

parameters.name: polygons
parameters.description: polygons with values on which to average

parameters.name: points
parameters.description: points from which to calculate the average

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: the field in the points features from which to pull values to average

parameters.name: outputField
parameters.description: the field in polygons to put results of the averages

returns.description: polygons with the value of outField set to the calculated averages

functions.name: turf/bbox-polygon
functions.description: Takes a bbox and returns an equivalent  Polygon|polygon.

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: an Array of bounding box coordinates in the form: [xLow, yLow, xHigh, yHigh]

returns.description: a Polygon representation of the bounding box

functions.name: turf/bearing
functions.description: Takes two  Point|points and finds the geographic bearing between them.

functions.name: turf/bezier
functions.description:
Takes a  LineString|line and returns a curved version
by applying a Bezier spline
algorithm.
The bezier spline implementation is by Leszek Rybicki.

parameters.name: sharpness
parameters.description: a measure of how curvy the path should be between splines

functions.name: turf/buffer
functions.description: Calculates a buffer for input features for a given radius. Units supported are miles, kilometers, and degrees.

functions.name: turf/center
functions.description: Takes a  FeatureCollection and returns the absolute center point of all features.

returns.description: a Point feature at the absolute center point of all input features

functions.name: turf/centroid
functions.description:
Takes one or more features and calculates the centroid using the arithmetic mean of all vertices.
This lessens the effect of small islands and artifacts when calculating
the centroid of a set of polygons.

functions.name: turf/combine
functions.description: Combines a  FeatureCollection of {@link Point}, {@link LineString}, or {@link Polygon} features into {@link MultiPoint}, {@link MultiLineString}, or {@link MultiPolygon} features.

returns.description: a FeatureCollection of corresponding type to input

functions.name: turf/concave
functions.description:
Takes a set of  Point|points and returns a concave hull polygon.
Internally, this implements
a Monotone chain algorithm.

parameters.name: maxEdge
parameters.description: the size of an edge necessary for part of the hull to become concave (in miles)

functions.name: turf/convex
functions.description:
Takes a set of  Point|points and returns a
convex hull polygon.
Internally this uses
the convex-hull module that
implements a monotone chain hull.

functions.name: turf/count
functions.description: Takes a set of  Point|points and a set of {@link Polygon|polygons} and calculates the number of points that fall within the set of polygons.

parameters.name: countField
parameters.description: a field to append to the attributes of the Polygon features representing Point counts

functions.name: turf/destination
functions.description: Takes a  Point and calculates the location of a destination point given a distance in degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers; and bearing in degrees. This uses the Haversine formula to account for global curvature.

functions.name: turf/deviation
functions.description: Calculates the standard deviation value of a field for a set of  Point|points within a set of {@link Polygon|polygons}.

parameters.name: inField
parameters.description: the field in points from which to aggregate

parameters.name: outField
parameters.description: the field to append to polygons representing deviation

functions.name: turf/distance
functions.description:
Calculates the distance between two  Point|points in degress, radians,
miles, or kilometers. This uses the
Haversine formula
to account for global curvature.

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

functions.name: turf/envelope
functions.description: Takes any number of features and returns a rectangular  Polygon that encompasses all vertices.

returns.description: a rectangular Polygon feature that encompasses all vertices

functions.name: turf/difference
functions.description:
Finds the difference between two  Polygon|polygons by clipping the second
polygon from the first.

returns.description: a Polygon feature showing the area of poly1 excluding the area of poly2

functions.name: turf/explode
functions.description:
Takes a feature or set of features and returns all positions as
 Point|points.

functions.name: turf/extent
functions.description: Takes a set of features, calculates the extent of all input features, and returns a bounding box.

returns.description: the bounding box of input given as an array in WSEN order (west, south, east, north)

functions.name: turf/featurecollection
functions.description: Takes one or more  Feature|Features and creates a {@link FeatureCollection}.

functions.name: turf/filter
functions.description: Takes a  FeatureCollection and filters it by a given property and value.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: the value of that property on which to filter

returns.description: a filtered collection with only features that match input key and value

functions.name: turf/flip
functions.description:
Takes input features and flips all of their coordinates
from [x, y] to [y, x].

returns.description: a feature or set of features of the same type as input with flipped coordinates

functions.name: turf/hex-grid
functions.description:
Takes a bounding box and a cell size in degrees and returns a  FeatureCollection of flat-topped
hexagons ({@link Polygon} features) aligned in an "odd-q" vertical grid as
described in Hexagonal Grids.

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: bounding box in [minX, minY, maxX, maxY] order

functions.name: turf/inside
functions.description:
Takes a  Point and a {@link Polygon} or {@link MultiPolygon} and determines if the point resides inside the polygon. The polygon can
be convex or concave. The function accounts for holes.

returns.description: true if the Point is inside the Polygon; false if the Point is not inside the Polygon

functions.name: turf/intersect
functions.description: Takes two  Polygon|polygons and finds their intersection. If they share a border, returns the border; if they don't intersect, returns undefined.

returns.description: if poly1 and poly2 overlap, returns a Polygon feature representing the area they overlap; if poly1 and poly2 do not overlap, returns undefined; if poly1 and poly2 share a border, a MultiLineString of the locations where their borders are shared

functions.name: turf/isolines
functions.description:
Takes  Point|points with z-values and an array of
value breaks and generates isolines.

parameters.name: z
parameters.description: the property name in points from which z-values will be pulled

functions.name: turf/jenks
functions.description:
Takes a set of features and returns an array of the Jenks Natural breaks
for a given property

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: the property in input on which to calculate Jenks natural breaks

parameters.name: numberOfBreaks
parameters.description: number of classes in which to group the data

returns.description: the break number for each class plus the minimum and maximum values

functions.name: turf/kinks
functions.description: Takes a  Polygon|polygon and returns {@link Point|points} at all self-intersections.

functions.name: turf/line-distance
functions.description: Takes a  LineString|line and measures its length in the specified units.

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

functions.name: turf/line-slice
functions.description: Takes a  LineString|line, a start {@link Point}, and a stop point and returns the line in between those points

functions.name: turf/linestring
functions.description:
Creates a  LineString based on a
coordinate array. Properties can be added optionally.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: an Object of key-value pairs to add as properties

functions.name: turf/max
functions.description: Calculates the maximum value of a field for a set of  Point|points within a set of {@link Polygon|polygons}.

parameters.name: inField
parameters.description: the field in input data to analyze

parameters.name: outField
parameters.description: the field in which to store results

functions.name: turf/median
functions.description: Calculates the median value of a field for a set of  Point|points within a set of {@link Polygon|polygons}.

parameters.name: inField
parameters.description: the field in input data to analyze

parameters.name: outField
parameters.description: the field in which to store results

functions.name: turf/merge
functions.description:
Takes a set of  Polygon|polygons and returns a single merged
polygon feature. If the input polygon features are not contiguous, this function returns a {@link MultiPolygon} feature.

functions.name: turf/midpoint
functions.description: Takes two  Point|points and returns a point midway between them.

functions.name: turf/min
functions.description: Calculates the minimum value of a field for a set of  Point|points within a set of {@link Polygon|polygons}.

parameters.name: inField
parameters.description: the field in input data to analyze

parameters.name: outField
parameters.description: the field in which to store results

functions.name: turf/nearest
functions.description: Takes a reference  Point|point and a set of points and returns the point from the set closest to the reference.

returns.description: the closest point in the set to the reference point

functions.name: turf/planepoint
functions.description:
Takes a triangular plane as a  Polygon
and a {@link Point} within that triangle and returns the z-value
at that point. The Polygon needs to have properties a, b, and c
that define the values at its three corners.

parameters.name: interpolatedPoint
parameters.description: the Point for which a z-value will be calculated

functions.name: turf/point-grid
functions.description: Takes a bounding box and a cell depth and returns a set of  Point|points in a grid.

functions.name: turf/point-on-line
functions.description: Takes a  Point and a {@link LineString} and calculates the closest Point on the LineString.

functions.name: turf/point-on-surface
functions.description:
Takes a feature and returns a  Point guaranteed to be on the surface of the feature.

Given a {@link Polygon}, the point will be in the area of the polygon
Given a {@link LineString}, the point will be along the string
Given a {@link Point}, the point will the same as the input

functions.name: turf/point
functions.description: Takes coordinates and properties (optional) and returns a new  Point feature.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: an Object that is used as the {@link Feature}'s properties

functions.name: turf/polygon
functions.description: Takes an array of LinearRings and optionally an  Object with properties and returns a {@link Polygon} feature.

functions.name: turf/quantile
functions.description: Takes a  FeatureCollection, a property name, and a set of percentiles and returns a quantile array.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: the property in input from which to retrieve quantile values

parameters.name: percentiles
parameters.description: an Array of percentiles on which to calculate quantile values

functions.name: turf/random
functions.description:
Generates random  GeoJSON data, including {@link Point|Points} and {@link Polygon|Polygons}, for testing
and experimentation.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: options relevant to the feature desired. Can include:

parameters.name: options.bbox
parameters.description: a bounding box inside of which geometries are placed. In the case of {@link Point} features, they are guaranteed to be within this bounds, while {@link Polygon} features have their centroid within the bounds.

parameters.name: options.num_vertices
parameters.description: options.vertices the number of vertices added to polygon features.

parameters.name: options.max_radial_length
parameters.description: the total number of decimal degrees longitude or latitude that a polygon can extent outwards to from its center.

functions.name: turf/reclass
functions.description:
Takes a  FeatureCollection, an input field, an output field, and
an array of translations and outputs an identical FeatureCollection with
the output field property populated.

parameters.name: outField
parameters.description: the field in which to store translated results

returns.description: a FeatureCollection with identical geometries to input but with outField populated.

functions.name: turf/remove
functions.description:
Takes a  FeatureCollection of any type, a property, and a value and
returns a FeatureCollection with features matching that
property-value pair removed.

returns.description: the resulting FeatureCollection without features that match the property-value pair

functions.name: turf/sample
functions.description: Takes a  FeatureCollection and returns a FeatureCollection with given number of {@link Feature|features} at random.

functions.name: turf/simplify
functions.description: Takes a  LineString or {@link Polygon} and returns a simplified version. Internally uses simplify-js to perform simplification.

parameters.name: highQuality
parameters.description: whether or not to spend more time to create a higher-quality simplification with a different algorithm

functions.name: turf/size
functions.description:
Takes a bounding box and returns a new bounding box with a size expanded or contracted
by a factor of X.

parameters.name: factor
parameters.description: the ratio of the new bbox to the input bbox

functions.name: turf/square-grid
functions.description: Takes a bounding box and a cell depth and returns a set of square  Polygon|polygons in a grid.

functions.name: turf/square
functions.description: Takes a bounding box and calculates the minimum square bounding box that would contain the input.

functions.name: turf/sum
functions.description: Calculates the sum of a field for a set of  Point|points within a set of {@link Polygon|polygons}.

parameters.name: inField
parameters.description: the field in input data to analyze

parameters.name: outField
parameters.description: the field in which to store results

functions.name: turf/tag
functions.description: Takes a set of  Point|points and a set of {@link Polygon|polygons} and performs a spatial join.

parameters.name: polyId
parameters.description: property in polygons to add to joined Point features

parameters.name: containingPolyId
parameters.description: property in points in which to store joined property from `polygons

functions.name: turf/tin
functions.description:
Takes a set of  Point|points and the name of a z-value property and
creates a Triangulated Irregular Network,
or a TIN for short, returned as a collection of Polygons. These are often used
for developing elevation contour maps or stepped heat visualizations.
This triangulates the points, as well as adds properties called a, b,
and c representing the value of the given propertyName at each of
the points that represent the corners of the triangle.

parameters.name: propertyName
parameters.description: name of the property from which to pull z values This is optional: if not given, then there will be no extra data added to the derived triangles.

functions.name: turf/triangle-grid
functions.description: Takes a bounding box and a cell depth and returns a set of triangular  Polygon|polygons in a grid.

functions.name: turf/union
functions.description: Takes two  Polygon|polygons and returns a combined polygon. If the input polygons are not contiguous, this function returns a {@link MultiPolygon} feature.

functions.name: turf/variance
functions.description: Calculates the variance value of a field for a set of  Point|points within a set of {@link Polygon|polygons}.

parameters.name: inField
parameters.description: the field in input data to analyze

parameters.name: outField
parameters.description: the field in which to store results

functions.name: turf/within
functions.description: Takes a set of  Point|points and a set of {@link Polygon|polygons} and returns the points that fall within the polygons.

returns.description: points that land within at least one polygon
